Posts.Content: vijmom wrote: I am a 62 year old female.My cervical node biopsy shows metastasis poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma. The immunostains suggest it is breast cancer. However, the mammography and sonography of the breast found no lumps. The sonography also found a malignant node on the left axillary region (although a biopsy has not been done here so far). According to the immunohistochemical staining results for the cervical lymph node (on the neck), the Tumor Cells are ER(+), PR(+), HER-2(-), GCDFP-15(+), and TTF-1(-). Would I still have late stage breast cancer if mammography and sonography have found nothing? What'll be my life expectancy? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Metastatic Breast Cancer vijmom otter

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2008 02:31AM vijmom wrote: Dear Tender,          Thanks so much for the kind words.  All the info was very helpful. Cervical lymph node on my neck is between the ear and my shoulder.  I still have to find a good doc and take the next step.  I'm keeping my fingers crossed and hope to attend my grand daughter's wedding(She's 6).
Posts.Title: Metastatic Breast Cancer vijmom otter

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2008 04:12PM vijmom wrote: Hi Hanna,     I've stage IV Met and it has spread to my bone pretty much everywhere.  I'm thinking of applying for disabilty since the pain has taken over my life.  Can you help?  What did you do to get disabilty?  How difficult was it?  What're the things did you need to apply for it?  I heard that they require doc's dx, drugs and doses?  Please help....thanks in advance.
